The new binary data.
A to which the patch will be written.

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.BSDiff.Apply(System.IO.Stream,System.Func{System.IO.Stream},System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Applies a binary patch (in bsdiff format) to the data in and writes the results of patching to .
member.param: A containing the input data.
A func that can open a positioned at the start of the patch data. This stream must support reading and seeking, and must allow multiple streams on the patch to be opened concurrently.
A to which the patched data is written.

member.summary: Reads exactly bytes from .

The count of bytes to read.
member.returns: A new byte array containing the data read from the stream.

The buffer to read data into.
The offset within the buffer at which data is first written.

member.name: T:Wabbajack.Common.ChildProcessTracker
member.summary: Allows processes to be automatically killed if this parent process unexpectedly quits. This feature requires Windows 8 or greater. On Windows 7, nothing is done.

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.ChildProcessTracker.AddProcess(System.Diagnostics.Process)
member.summary: Add the process to be tracked. If our current process is killed, the child processes that we are tracking will be automatically killed, too. If the child process terminates first, that's fine, too.

member.summary: Parses the argument and sets the properties of

member.summary: Other games this game can pull source files from (if the game is installed on the user's machine)

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.GameRegistry.GetByFuzzyName(System.String)
member.summary: Parse game data from an arbitrary string. Tries first via parsing as a game Enum, then by Nexus name. Name to query GameMetaData found If string could not be translated to a game

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.GameRegistry.TryGetByFuzzyName(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to parse game data from an arbitrary string. Tries first via parsing as a game Enum, then by Nexus name. Name to query GameMetaData if found, otherwise null

member.name: T:Wabbajack.Common.Hash
member.summary: Struct representing a xxHash64 value. It's a struct with a ulong in it, but wrapped so we don't confuse it with other longs in the system.

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.Utils.ViaJSON``1(``0)
member.summary: Roundtrips the value through the JSON routines

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.Utils.DeleteDirectory(Wabbajack.Common.AbsolutePath)
member.summary: Both AlphaFS and C#'s Directory.Delete sometimes fail when certain files are read-only or have other weird attributes. This is the only 100% reliable way I've found to completely delete a folder. If you don't like this code, it's unlikely to change without a ton of testing.

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.Utils.ToEcryptedJson``1(``0,System.String)
member.summary: Writes a file to JSON but in an encrypted format in the user's app local directory. The data will be encrypted so that it can only be read by this machine and this user.

member.name: T:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolder
member.summary: Represents a special Windows directory and provides methods to retrieve information about it.

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolder.#ctor(Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolderType)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the folder of the given type. It provides the values for the current user.
member.param: The of the known folder to represent.

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolder.#ctor(Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolderType,System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the folder of the given type. It provides the values for the given impersonated user.
member.param: The of the known folder to represent.
The of the impersonated user which values will be provided.

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolder.Type
member.summary: Gets the type of the known folder which is represented.

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolder.Identity
member.summary: Gets the of the user whose folder values are provided.

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolder.DefaultPath
member.summary: Gets the default path of the folder. This does not require the folder to be existent.
member.exception: The known folder could not be retrieved.

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolder.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets the path as currently configured. This does not require the folder to be existent.
member.exception: The known folder could not be retrieved.

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolder.ExpandedPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the path as currently configured, with all environment variables expanded. This does not require the folder to be existent.
member.exception: The known folder could not be retrieved.

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolder.Create
member.summary: Creates the folder using its Desktop.ini settings.
member.exception: The known folder could not be retrieved.

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolder.SHGetKnownFolderPath(System.Guid,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Retrieves the full path of a known folder identified by the folder's known folder ID.
member.param: A known folder ID that identifies the folder.
Flags that specify special retrieval options. This value can be 0; otherwise, one or more of the values.

An access token that represents a particular user. If this parameter is NULL, which is the most common usage, the function requests the known folder for the current user. Assigning a value of -1 indicates the Default User. The default user profile is duplicated when any new user account is created. Note that access to the Default User folders requires administrator privileges.
When this method returns, contains the address of a string that specifies the path of the known folder. The returned path does not include a trailing backslash.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise.

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolder.SHSetKnownFolderPath(System.Guid,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Redirects a known folder to a new location.
member.param: A that identifies the known folder.
Either 0 or .

member.name: T:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolder.KnownFolderFlags
member.summary: Represents the retrieval options for known folders.

member.name: T:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolders
member.summary: A collection of properties to retrieve specific file system paths for the current user.

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolders.AccountPictures
member.summary: The per-user Account Pictures folder. Introduced in Windows 8. Defaults to "%APPDATA%\Microsoft\Windows\AccountPictures".

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolders.AdminTools
member.summary: The per-user Administrative Tools folder. Defaults to "%APPDATA%\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Administrative Tools".

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolders.AppDataDesktop
member.summary: The per-user app desktop folder, used internally by .NET applications to perform cross-platform app functionality. Introduced in Windows 10. Defaults to "%LOCALAPPDATA%\Desktop".

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolders.AppDataDocuments
member.summary: The per-user app documents folder, used internally by .NET applications to perform cross-platform app functionality. Introduced in Windows 10. Defaults to "%LOCALAPPDATA%\Documents".

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolders.ProgramFiles
member.summary: The fixed Program Files folder. This is the same as the known folder in 32-bit applications or the known folder in 64-bit applications. Points to %SYSTEMDRIVE%\Program Files on a 32-bit operating system or in 64-bit applications on a 64-bit operating system and to %SYSTEMDRIVE%\Program Files (x86) in 32-bit applications on a 64-bit operating system.

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolders.ProgramFilesX64
member.summary: The fixed Program Files folder (64-bit forced). This known folder is unsupported in 32-bit applications. Points to %SYSTEMDRIVE%\Program Files.

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolders.ProgramFilesX86
member.summary: The fixed Program Files folder (32-bit forced). This is the same as the known folder in 32-bit applications. Points to "%SYSTEMDRIVE%\Program Files" on a 32-bit operating system and to "%SYSTEMDRIVE%\Program Files (x86)" on a 64-bit operating system.

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolders.ProgramFilesCommon
member.summary: The fixed Common Files folder. This is the same as the known folder in 32-bit applications or the known folder in 64-bit applications. Points to" %PROGRAMFILES%\Common Files" on a 32-bit operating system or in 64-bit applications on a 64-bit operating system and to "%PROGRAMFILES(X86)%\Common Files" in 32-bit applications on a 64-bit operating system.

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolders.ProgramFilesCommonX64
member.summary: The fixed Common Files folder (64-bit forced). This known folder is unsupported in 32-bit applications. Points to "%PROGRAMFILES%\Common Files".

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolders.ProgramFilesCommonX86
member.summary: The fixed Common Files folder (32-bit forced). This is the same as the known folder in 32-bit applications. Points to "%PROGRAMFILES%\Common Files" on a 32-bit operating system and to "%PROGRAMFILES(X86)%\Common Files" on a 64-bit operating system.

member.summary: The fixed System32 folder. This is the same as the known folder in 32-bit applications. Points to "%WINDIR%\system32" on 32-bit operating systems or in 64-bit applications on a 64-bit operating system and to "%WINDIR%\syswow64" in 32-bit applications on a 64-bit operating system.

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolders.SystemX86

member.name: T:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolderType
member.summary: Represents the list of standard folders registered with the system. These folders are installed with Windows Vista and later operating systems, and a computer will have only folders appropriate to it installed.

member.summary: The per-user Account Pictures folder. Introduced in Windows 8. Defaults to "%APPDATA%\Microsoft\Windows\AccountPictures".

member.name: F:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolderType.AppDataDesktop
member.summary: The per-user app desktop folder, used internally by .NET applications to perform cross-platform app functionality. Introduced in Windows 10. Defaults to "%LOCALAPPDATA%\Desktop".

member.summary: The fixed ProgramData folder. Points to "%ALLUSERSPROFILE%" ("%PROGRAMDATA%", "%SYSTEMDRIVE%\ProgramData").

member.name: F:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolderType.ProgramFiles
member.summary: The fixed Program Files folder. This is the same as the known folder in 32-bit applications or the known folder in 64-bit applications. Points to %SYSTEMDRIVE%\Program Files on a 32-bit operating system or in 64-bit applications on a 64-bit operating system and to %SYSTEMDRIVE%\Program Files (x86) in 32-bit applications on a 64-bit operating system.

member.name: F:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolderType.ProgramFilesX64
member.summary: The fixed Program Files folder (64-bit forced). This known folder is unsupported in 32-bit applications. Points to %SYSTEMDRIVE%\Program Files.

member.name: F:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolderType.ProgramFilesX86
member.summary: The fixed Program Files folder (32-bit forced). This is the same as the known folder in 32-bit applications. Points to "%SYSTEMDRIVE%\Program Files" on a 32-bit operating system and to "%SYSTEMDRIVE%\Program Files (x86)" on a 64-bit operating system.

member.name: F:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolderType.ProgramFilesCommon
member.summary: The fixed Common Files folder. This is the same as the known folder in 32-bit applications or the known folder in 64-bit applications. Points to" %PROGRAMFILES%\Common Files" on a 32-bit operating system or in 64-bit applications on a 64-bit operating system and to "%PROGRAMFILES(X86)%\Common Files" in 32-bit applications on a 64-bit operating system.

member.name: F:Wabbajack.Common.IO.KnownFolderType.ProgramFilesCommonX64
member.summary: The fixed Common Files folder (64-bit forced). This known folder is unsupported in 32-bit applications. Points to "%PROGRAMFILES%\Common Files".

member.summary: The fixed Common Files folder (32-bit forced). This is the same as the known folder in 32-bit applications. Points to "%PROGRAMFILES%\Common Files" on a 32-bit operating system and to "%PROGRAMFILES(X86)%\Common Files" on a 64-bit operating system.

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.AbsolutePath.EntryPoint
member.summary: Returns the full path the folder that contains Wabbajack.Common. This will almost always be where all the binaries for the project reside.

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.AbsolutePath.WindowsFolder
member.summary: Returns the path to the Windows folder, most often c:\Windows

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.AbsolutePath.MoveToAsync(Wabbajack.Common.AbsolutePath,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves this file to the specified location, will use Copy if required
member.param: Replace the destination file if it exists

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.AbsolutePath.EnumerateFiles(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Assuming the path is a folder, enumerate all the files in the folder
member.param: if true, also returns files in sub-folders
pattern to match against

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.FullPath.InSameFolder(Wabbajack.Common.RelativePath)
member.summary: Creates a new full path, with relativePath combined with the deepest leaf in the full path

member.name: P:Wabbajack.Common.IPath.FileName
member.summary: Get the final file name, for c:\bar\baz this is `baz` for c:\bar.zip this is `bar.zip` for `bar.zip` this is `bar.zip`

member.name: T:Wabbajack.Common.Serialization.Json.JsonNameAttribute
member.summary: Defines the polymorphic name of this type when serialized via Json. This value will be stored in the "_wjType" field.

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.StatusUpdateTracker.OverAllStatus(Wabbajack.Common.Percent)
member.summary: Converts a percent that's within the scope of a single step to the overall percent when all steps are considered
member.param: Percent progress of the current single step
member.returns: Overall progress in relation to all steps

member.name: T:Wabbajack.Common.DiskSlabAllocator
member.summary: Memory allocator that stores data via memory mapping to a on-disk file. Disposing of this object deletes the memory mapped file

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.TempFolder.Warmup
member.summary: Starts the initialization in a background task

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.WorkQueue.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Creates a WorkQueue with the given number of threads
member.param: Number of threads for the WorkQueue to have. Null represents default, which is the Processor count of the machine.

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.WorkQueue.#ctor(System.IObservable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Creates a WorkQueue whos number of threads is determined by the given observable
member.param: Driving observable that determines how many threads should be actively pulling jobs from the queue

member.name: M:Wabbajack.Common.WorkQueue.SetActiveThreadsObservable(System.IObservable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Sets the driving observable that determines how many threads should be actively pulling jobs from the queue
member.param: Driving observable that determines how many threads should be actively pulling jobs from the queue

member.name: M:Wabbajack.RxExt.Unit``1(System.IObservable{``0})
member.summary: Converts any observable to type Unit. Useful for when you care that a signal occurred, but don't care about what its value is downstream.
member.returns: An observable that returns Unit anytime the source signal fires an event.

member.name: M:Wabbajack.RxExt.FlowSwitch``1(System.IObservable{``0},System.IObservable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Convenience operator to subscribe to the source observable, only when a second "switch" observable is on. When the switch is on, the source will be subscribed to, and its updates passed through. When the switch is off, the subscription to the source observable will be stopped, and no signal will be published.
member.param: Source observable to subscribe to if on
On/Off signal of whether to subscribe to source observable
member.returns: Observable that publishes data from source, if the switch is on.

member.name: M:Wabbajack.RxExt.FlowSwitch``1(System.IObservable{``0},System.IObservable{System.Boolean},``0)
member.summary: Convenience operator to subscribe to the source observable, only when a second "switch" observable is on. When the switch is on, the source will be subscribed to, and its updates passed through. When the switch is off, the subscription to the source observable will be stopped, and no signal will be published.
